text: Hot Springs County is a county in the U.S. state of Wyoming. As of the 2020 United States Census, 4,621 people lived there. Its county seat is Thermopolis. The county is named for the hot springs located in Hot Springs State Park. Hot Springs County was created on February 21, 1911. == Communities == === Towns === * East Thermopolis * Kirby * Thermopolis (county seat) === Census-designated places === * Lucerne * Owl Creek === Unincorporated communities === * Embar * Grass Creek * Wedding of the Waters === Ghost towns === * Gebo == References == == Other websites == * Hot Springs County official website Category:1911 establishments in Wyoming Category:Wyoming counties
title: Hot Springs County, Wyoming
